title-group.article-title: Corporate Acquisitions: Method of Payment Effects, Capital Structure Effects, and Bidding Firms Stock Returns

abstract.p: This study examines the effects of both the method of payment and the capital structure rearrangements on the common stock returns of bidding firms at the initial announcement of takeover bids. The evidence suggests that cash offers generate consistently higher abnormal returns than do stock exchanges. In both cash offers and stock exchanges, abnormal returns are not affected by the market's perception of changes in the firm's capital structure.
